RECORD:
Rare disease patients have complex clinical representations. Patients with Epileptic Encephalopathy, Early Infantile, 3 present clinical features that include epilepsy, intellectual disability, ataxia, and microcephaly.

Epileptic Encephalopathy, Early Infantile, 3 is caused by mutations in the KCNT1 gene and is inherited in an autosomal recessive manner.

This test is available for the following ethnic groups:. Some special cases also present an increased risk of having Epileptic Encephalopathy, Early Infantile, 3.
